   20: 
   21: -module(code_SUITE).
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23:          versions/1,new_binary_types/1,
   24:          bad_beam_file/1,
   25:          literal_leak/1,
   26:          call_purged_fun_code_gone/1,
   27:          call_purged_fun_code_reload/1,
   28:          call_purged_fun_code_there/1,
   29:          multi_proc_purge/1, t_check_old_code/1,
   30:          many_purges/1,
   31:          external_fun/1,get_chunk/1,module_md5/1,
   32:          constant_pools/1,constant_refc_binaries/1,
   33:          fake_literals/1,
   34:          false_dependency/1,coverage/1,fun_confusion/1,
   35:          t_copy_literals/1, t_copy_literals_frags/1,
   36:          erl_544/1, max_heap_size/1,
   37: 	 check_process_code_signal_order/1,
   38: 	 check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc/1]).
   39: 
   40: -define(line_trace, 1).
   41: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   42: 
   43: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   44: 
   45: all() ->
   46:     [versions, new_binary_types,
   47:      bad_beam_file, literal_leak,
   48:      call_purged_fun_code_gone,
   49:      call_purged_fun_code_reload, call_purged_fun_code_there,
   50:      multi_proc_purge, t_check_old_code, external_fun, get_chunk,
   51:      module_md5, many_purges,
   52:      constant_pools, constant_refc_binaries, fake_literals,
   53:      false_dependency,
   54:      coverage, fun_confusion, t_copy_literals, t_copy_literals_frags,
   55:      erl_544, max_heap_size, check_process_code_signal_order,
   56:      check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc].
   57: 
   58: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   59:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   63:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   64:     ok.
   65: 
   66: %% Make sure that only two versions of a module can be loaded.
   67: versions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     V1 = compile_version(1, Config),
   69:     V2 = compile_version(2, Config),
   70:     V3 = compile_version(3, Config),
   71: 
   72:     {ok,P1,1} = load_version(V1, 1),
   73:     {ok,P2,2} = load_version(V2, 2),
   74:     {error,not_purged} = load_version(V2, 2),
   75:     {error,not_purged} = load_version(V3, 3),
   76: 
   77:     1 = check_version(P1),
   78:     2 = check_version(P2),
   79:     2 = versions:version(),
   80: 
   81:     %% Kill processes, unload code.
   82:     _ = monitor(process, P1),
   83:     _ = monitor(process, P2),
   84:     P1 ! P2 ! done,
   85:     receive
   86:         {'DOWN',_,process,P1,normal} -> ok
   87:     end,
   88:     receive
   89:         {'DOWN',_,process,P2,normal} -> ok
   90:     end,
   91:     true = erlang:purge_module(versions),
   92:     true = erlang:delete_module(versions),
   93:     true = erlang:purge_module(versions),
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: compile_version(Version, Config) ->
   97:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   98:     File = filename:join(Data, "versions"),
   99:     {ok,versions,Bin} = compile:file(File, [{d,'VERSION',Version},
  100:                                             binary,report]),
  101:     Bin.
  102: 
  103: load_version(Code, Ver) ->
  104:     case erlang:load_module(versions, Code) of
  105:         {module,versions} ->
  106:             Pid = spawn_link(versions, loop, []),
  107:             Ver = versions:version(),
  108:             Ver = check_version(Pid),
  109:             {ok,Pid,Ver};
  110:         Error ->
  111:             Error
  112:     end.
  113: 
  114: check_version(Pid) ->
  115:     Pid ! {self(),version},
  116:     receive
  117:         {Pid,version,Version} ->
  118:             Version
  119:     end.
  120: 
  121: new_binary_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  122:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  123:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  124:     {ok,my_code_test,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  125:     {module,my_code_test} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  126:                                                make_sub_binary(Bin)),
  127:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  128:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  129: 
  130:     {module,my_code_test} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  131:                                                make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin)),
  132:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  133:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  134: 
  135:     %% Try heap binaries and bad binaries.
  136:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test, <<1,2>>),
  137:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  138:                                          make_sub_binary(<<1,2>>)),
  139:     {error,badfile} = erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  140:                                          make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<1,2>>)),
  141:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:load_module(my_code_test,
  142:                                                     bit_sized_binary(Bin))),
  143:     ok.
  144: 
  145: %% Ensure that the loader doesn't crash or leak memory when attempting
  146: %% to load bad BEAM files. We depend on valgrind to notice leaks.
  147: bad_beam_file(_Config) ->
  148:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  149: 
  150:     BadBeam1 = bad_beam_file_1(Mod),
  151:     {error,badfile} = code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), BadBeam1),
  152: 
  153:     BadBeam2 = bad_beam_file_2(Mod),
  154:     {error,badfile} = code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), BadBeam2),
  155: 
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: %% Build a BEAM file with an invalid instruction in the code chunk.
  159: bad_beam_file_1(Mod) ->
  160:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  161:     Attr = [],
  162:     Fs = [{function,term,0,3,
  163:            [{label,1},
  164:             {line,[]},
  165:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  166:             {label,2},
  167:             {move,nil,nil},                     %Illegal destination.
  168:             return]}],
  169:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  170: 
  171:     %% Bypass beam_validator.
  172:     {ok,BadBeam} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  173:     BadBeam.
  174: 
  175: %% Build a BEAM file with an invalid attributes chunk.
  176: bad_beam_file_2(Mod) ->
  177:     Asm = {Mod,[],[],[],1},
  178:     {ok,BadBeam0} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  179:     {ok, Mod, Chunks0} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BadBeam0),
  180:     Chunks1 = lists:keydelete("Attr", 1, Chunks0),
  181:     Chunks = [{"Attr",<<"bad_attribute_chunk">>} | Chunks1],
  182:     {ok,BadBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(Chunks),
  183:     BadBeam.
  184: 
  185: %% Ensure that literal areas don't leak when erlang:prepare_loading/2
  186: %% is not followed by erlang:finish_loading/1.
  187: literal_leak(_Config) ->
  188:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  189:     HugeLiteral = binary_to_list(<<0:(1024*1024)/unit:8>>),
  190:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  191:     Attr = [],
  192:     Fs = [{function,term,0,3,
  193:            [{label,1},
  194:             {line,[]},
  195:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  196:             {label,2},
  197:             {move,{literal,HugeLiteral},{x,0}},
  198:             return]}],
  199:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  200:     {ok,Beam} = beam_asm:module(Asm, [], [], []),
  201: 
  202:     %% valgrind cannot help us find leak of literals because literal
  203:     %% areas are allocated using mmap().
  204:     %%
  205:     %% Instead we will prepare for loading a BEAM file with a 16Mb
  206:     %% literal N times so that the reserved literal memory range will
  207:     %% overflow.
  208:     %%
  209:     %% Setting N to 64 is sufficient for overflowing a 1 GB literal
  210:     %% area (which is the size at the time of writing). Just to be
  211:     %% sure, we will go a little bit higher...
  212: 
  213:     N = 128,
  214:     _ = [begin
  215:              _ = erlang:prepare_loading(Mod, Beam),
  216:              _ = erlang:garbage_collect()
  217:          end || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  218:     ok.
  219: 
  220: call_purged_fun_code_gone(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  221:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_gone_test/1, Config).
  222: 
  223: call_purged_fun_code_gone_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  224:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  225:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  226:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_gone),
  227:     ok.
  228: 
  229: call_purged_fun_code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  230:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_reload_test/1, Config).
  231: 
  232: call_purged_fun_code_reload_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  234:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  235:     Path = code:get_path(),
  236:     true = code:add_path(Priv),
  237:     try
  238: 	call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_reload)
  239:     after
  240: 	code:set_path(Path)
  241:     end,
  242:     ok.
  243: 
  244: call_purged_fun_code_there(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     run_sys_proc_test(fun call_purged_fun_code_there_test/1, Config).
  246: 
  247: call_purged_fun_code_there_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  248:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  249:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  250:     call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, code_there),
  251:     ok.
  252: 
  253: call_purged_fun_test(Priv, Data, Type) ->
  254:     SrcFile = filename:join(Data, "call_purged_fun_tester.erl"),
  255:     ObjFile = filename:join(Priv, "call_purged_fun_tester.beam"),
  256:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(SrcFile, [binary, report]),
  257:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  258: 
  259:     call_purged_fun_tester:do(Priv, Data, Type, []).
  260: 
  261: 
  262: multi_proc_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  263:     run_sys_proc_test(fun multi_proc_purge_test/1, Config).
  264: 
  265: multi_proc_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  266:     %%
  267:     %% Make sure purge requests aren't lost when
  268:     %% purger process is working.
  269:     %%
  270:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  271:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  272:     File1 = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  273:     File2 = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test2"),
  274:     
  275:     {ok,my_code_test} = c:c(File1, [{outdir,Priv}]),
  276:     {ok,my_code_test2} = c:c(File2, [{outdir,Priv}]),
  277:     erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  278:     erlang:delete_module(my_code_test2),
  279: 
  280:     Self = self(),
  281: 
  282:     Fun1 = fun () ->
  283: 		   erts_code_purger:purge(my_code_test),
  284: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  285: 	   end,
  286:     Fun2 = fun () ->
  287: 		   erts_code_purger:soft_purge(my_code_test2),
  288: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  289: 	   end,
  290:     Fun3 = fun () ->
  291: 		   erts_code_purger:purge('__nonexisting_module__'),
  292: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  293: 	   end,
  294:     Fun4 = fun () ->
  295: 		   erts_code_purger:soft_purge('__another_nonexisting_module__'),
  296: 		   Self ! {self(), done}
  297: 	   end,
  298: 
  299:     Pid1 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  300:     Pid2 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  301:     Pid3 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  302:     Pid4 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  303:     Pid5 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  304:     Pid6 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  305:     Pid7 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  306:     receive after 50 -> ok end,
  307:     Pid8 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  308:     Pid9 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  309:     Pid10 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  310:     Pid11 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  311:     Pid12 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  312:     Pid13 = spawn_link(Fun1),
  313:     receive after 50 -> ok end,
  314:     Pid14 = spawn_link(Fun2),
  315:     Pid15 = spawn_link(Fun3),
  316:     Pid16 = spawn_link(Fun4),
  317: 
  318:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, done} -> ok end end,
  319: 		  [Pid1, Pid2, Pid3, Pid4, Pid5, Pid6, Pid7, Pid8,
  320: 		   Pid9, Pid10, Pid11, Pid12, Pid13, Pid14, Pid15, Pid16]),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: %% Test the erlang:check_old_code/1 BIF.
  324: t_check_old_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  325:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  326:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  327: 
  328:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  329:     catch erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  330:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  331: 
  332:     false = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  333: 
  334:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  335:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  336: 
  337:     false = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  338:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  339:     true = erlang:check_old_code(my_code_test),
  340: 
  341:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  342:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  343:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  344: 
  345:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:check_old_code([])),
  346: 
  347:     ok.
  348: 
  349: many_purges(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  350:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  351:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  352: 
  353:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  354:     catch erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  355:     catch erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  356:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  357: 
  358:     ct:log("Process count: ~p~n", [erlang:system_info(process_count)]),
  359: 
  360:     many_purges_test(File, Code, 1000),
  361: 
  362:     Rand = fun Rand() ->
  363:                    _ = lists:seq(1, rand:uniform(100)),
  364:                    receive after rand:uniform(10) -> ok end,
  365:                    Rand()
  366:            end,
  367:     Ps0 = lists:map(fun (_) -> spawn(Rand) end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
  368: 
  369:     ct:log("Process count: ~p~n", [erlang:system_info(process_count)]),
  370: 
  371:     many_purges_test(File, Code, 1000),
  372: 
  373:     Ps1 = lists:map(fun (_) -> spawn(Rand) end, lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  374: 
  375:     ct:log("Process count: ~p~n", [erlang:system_info(process_count)]),
  376: 
  377:     many_purges_test(File, Code, 1000),
  378: 
  379:     Ps = Ps0 ++ Ps1,
  380: 
  381:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, Ps),
  382:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> false = is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
  383: 
  384:     ok.
  385: 
  386: many_purges_test(_File, _Code, 0) ->
  387:     ok;
  388: many_purges_test(File, Code, N) ->
  389:     {module,my_code_test} = code:load_binary(my_code_test, File, Code),
  390:     true = erlang:delete_module(my_code_test),
  391:     true = erlang:purge_module(my_code_test),
  392:     many_purges_test(File, Code, N-1).
  393: 
  394: external_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  395:     false = erlang:function_exported(another_code_test, x, 1),
  396:     AnotherCodeTest = id(another_code_test),
  397:     ExtFun = fun AnotherCodeTest:x/1,
  398:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch ExtFun(answer)),
  399:     false = erlang:function_exported(another_code_test, x, 1),
  400:     false = lists:member(another_code_test, erlang:loaded()),
  401:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  402:     File = filename:join(Data, "another_code_test"),
  403:     {ok,another_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary,report]),
  404:     {module,another_code_test} = erlang:load_module(another_code_test, Code),
  405:     42 = ExtFun(answer),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: get_chunk(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  409:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  410:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  411:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  412: 
  413:     %% Should work.
  414:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", Code),
  415:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", make_sub_binary(Code)),
  416:     Chunk = get_chunk_ok("AtU8", make_unaligned_sub_binary(Code)),
  417: 
  418:     %% Should fail.
  419:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:get_chunk(bit_sized_binary(Code), "AtU8")),
  420:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:get_chunk(Code, "bad chunk id")),
  421: 
  422:     %% Invalid beam code or missing chunk should return 'undefined'.
  423:     undefined = code:get_chunk(<<"not a beam module">>, "AtU8"),
  424:     undefined = code:get_chunk(Code, "XXXX"),
  425: 
  426:     ok.
  427: 
  428: get_chunk_ok(Chunk, Code) ->
  429:     case code:get_chunk(Code, Chunk) of
  430:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) -> Bin
  431:     end.
  432: 
  433: module_md5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  434:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  435:     File = filename:join(Data, "my_code_test"),
  436:     {ok,my_code_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  437: 
  438:     %% Should work.
  439:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(Code),
  440:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(make_sub_binary(Code)),
  441:     Chunk = module_md5_ok(make_unaligned_sub_binary(Code)),
  442: 
  443:     %% Should fail.
  444:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch code:module_md5(bit_sized_binary(Code))),
  445: 
  446:     %% Invalid beam code should return 'undefined'.
  447:     undefined = code:module_md5(<<"not a beam module">>),
  448:     ok.
  449: 
  450: module_md5_ok(Code) ->
  451:     case code:module_md5(Code) of
  452:         Bin when is_binary(Bin), size(Bin) =:= 16 -> Bin
  453:     end.
  454: 
  455: 
  456: constant_pools(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  457:     run_sys_proc_test(fun constant_pools_test/1, Config).
  458: 
  459: constant_pools_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  460:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  461:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  462:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  463:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals,
  464:                                            make_sub_binary(Code)),
  465: 
  466:     %% Initialize.
  467:     A = literals:a(),
  468:     B = literals:b(),
  469:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  470:     D = literals:funs(),
  471:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  472:     Self = self(),
  473: 
  474:     %% Have a process WITHOUT old heap that references the literals
  475:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  476:     NoOldHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> no_old_heap(Self) end),
  477:     receive go -> ok end,
  478:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  479:     false = erlang:check_process_code(NoOldHeap, literals),
  480:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  481:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  482:     NoOldHeap ! done,
  483:     receive
  484:         {'EXIT',NoOldHeap,{A,B,C,D}} ->
  485:             ok;
  486:         Other_NoOldHeap ->
  487:             ct:fail({unexpected,Other_NoOldHeap})
  488:     end,
  489:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  490: 
  491:     %% Have a process with an inconsistent heap (legal while GC is disabled)
  492:     %% that references the literals in the 'literals' module.
  493:     InconsistentHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> inconsistent_heap(Self) end),
  494:     receive go -> ok end,
  495:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  496:     false = erlang:check_process_code(InconsistentHeap, literals),
  497:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  498:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  499:     InconsistentHeap ! done,
  500:     receive
  501:         {'EXIT',InconsistentHeap,{A,B,C}} ->
  502:             ok;
  503:         Other_InconsistentHeap ->
  504:             ct:fail({unexpected,Other_InconsistentHeap})
  505:     end,
  506:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  507: 
  508:     %% Have a process WITH an old heap that references the literals
  509:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  510:     OldHeap = spawn_link(fun() -> old_heap(Self) end),
  511:     receive go -> ok end,
  512:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  513:     false = erlang:check_process_code(OldHeap, literals),
  514:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  515:     erlang:purge_module(literals),
  516:     OldHeap ! done,
  517:     receive
  518: 	{'EXIT',OldHeap,{A,B,C,D,[1,2,3|_]=Seq}} when length(Seq) =:= 16 ->
  519: 	    ok
  520:     end,
  521: 
  522:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  523:     %% Have a hibernated process that references the literals
  524:     %% in the 'literals' module.
  525:     {Hib, Mon} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> hibernated(Self) end),
  526:     receive go -> ok end,
  527:     [{heap_size,OldHeapSz},
  528:      {total_heap_size,OldTotHeapSz}] = process_info(Hib, [heap_size,
  529: 							  total_heap_size]),
  530:     OldHeapSz = OldTotHeapSz,
  531:     io:format("OldHeapSz=~p OldTotHeapSz=~p~n", [OldHeapSz, OldTotHeapSz]),
  532:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  533:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Hib, literals),
  534:     erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  535:     erlang:purge_module(literals),
  536:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  537:     [{heap_size,HeapSz},
  538:      {total_heap_size,TotHeapSz}] = process_info(Hib, [heap_size,
  539: 						       total_heap_size]),
  540:     io:format("HeapSz=~p TotHeapSz=~p~n", [HeapSz, TotHeapSz]),
  541:     Hib ! hej,
  542:     receive
  543: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Hib, Reason} ->
  544: 	    {undef, [{no_module,
  545: 		      no_function,
  546: 		      [{A,B,C,D,[1,2,3|_]=Seq}], _}]} = Reason,
  547: 	    16 = length(Seq)
  548:     end,
  549:     HeapSz = TotHeapSz, %% Ensure restored to hibernated state...
  550:     true = HeapSz > OldHeapSz,
  551:     ok.
  552: 
  553: no_old_heap(Parent) ->
  554:     A = literals:a(),
  555:     B = literals:b(),
  556:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  557:     D = literals:funs(),
  558:     Res = {A,B,C,D},
  559:     Parent ! go,
  560:     receive
  561:         done ->
  562:             exit(Res)
  563:     end.
  564: 
  565: old_heap(Parent) ->
  566:     A = literals:a(),
  567:     B = literals:b(),
  568:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  569:     D = literals:funs(),
  570:     Res = {A,B,C,D,lists:seq(1, 16)},
  571:     create_old_heap(),
  572:     Parent ! go,
  573:     receive
  574:         done ->
  575:             exit(Res)
  576:     end.
  577: 
  578: inconsistent_heap(Parent) ->
  579:     A = literals:a(),
  580:     B = literals:b(),
  581:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  582:     Res = {A,B,C},
  583:     Parent ! go,
  584: 
  585:     %% Disable the GC and return a tuple whose arity and contents are broken
  586:     BrokenTerm = erts_debug:set_internal_state(inconsistent_heap, start),
  587:     receive
  588:     after 5000 ->
  589:         %% Fix the tuple and enable the GC again
  590:         ok = erts_debug:set_internal_state(inconsistent_heap, BrokenTerm),
  591:         erlang:garbage_collect()
  592:     end,
  593: 
  594:     receive
  595:         done ->
  596:             exit(Res)
  597:     end.
  598: 
  599: hibernated(Parent) ->
  600:     A = literals:a(),
  601:     B = literals:b(),
  602:     C = literals:huge_bignum(),
  603:     D = literals:funs(),
  604:     Res = {A,B,C,D,lists:seq(1, 16)},
  605:     Parent ! go,
  606:     erlang:hibernate(no_module, no_function, [Res]).
  607: 
  608: create_old_heap() ->
  609:     case process_info(self(), [heap_size,total_heap_size]) of
  610:         [{heap_size,Sz},{total_heap_size,Total}] when Sz < Total ->
  611:             ok;
  612:         _ ->
  613:             create_old_heap()
  614:     end.
  615: 
  616: constant_refc_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  617:     run_sys_proc_test(fun constant_refc_binaries_test/1, Config).
  618: 
  619: constant_refc_binaries_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  620:     wait_for_memory_deallocations(),
  621:     Bef = memory_binary(),
  622:     io:format("Binary data (bytes) before test: ~p\n", [Bef]),
  623: 
  624:     %% Compile the the literals module.
  625:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  626:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  627:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  628: 
  629:     %% Load the code and make sure that the binary is a refc binary.
  630:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  631:     Bin = literals:binary(),
  632:     Sz = byte_size(Bin),
  633:     Check = erlang:md5(Bin),
  634:     io:format("Size of literal refc binary: ~p\n", [Sz]),
  635:     {refc_binary,Sz,_,_} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({binary_info,Bin}),
  636:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  637:     false = erlang:check_process_code(self(), literals),
  638:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  639: 
  640:     %% Now try to provoke a memory leak.
  641:     provoke_mem_leak(10, Code, Check),
  642: 
  643:     %% Calculate the change in allocated binary data.
  644:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  645:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  646:     wait_for_memory_deallocations(),
  647:     Aft = memory_binary(),
  648:     io:format("Binary data (bytes) after test: ~p", [Aft]),
  649:     Diff = Aft - Bef,
  650:     if
  651:         Diff < 0 ->
  652:             io:format("~p less bytes", [abs(Diff)]);
  653:         Diff > 0 ->
  654:             io:format("~p more bytes", [Diff]);
  655:         true ->
  656:             ok
  657:     end,
  658: 
  659:     %% Test for leaks. We must accept some natural variations in
  660:     %% the size of allocated binaries.
  661:     if
  662:         Diff > 64*1024 ->
  663:             ct:fail(binary_leak);
  664:         true ->
  665:             ok
  666:     end.
  667: 
  668: memory_binary() ->
  669:     try
  670:         erlang:memory(binary)
  671:     catch
  672:         error:notsup ->
  673:             0
  674:     end.
  675: 
  676: provoke_mem_leak(0, _, _) -> ok;
  677: provoke_mem_leak(N, Code, Check) ->
  678:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  679: 
  680:     %% Create several processes with references to the literal binary.
  681:     Self = self(),
  682:     Pids = [spawn_link(fun() ->
  683:                                create_binaries(Self, NumRefs, Check)
  684:                        end) || NumRefs <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  685:     [receive {started,Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  686: 
  687:     %% Make the code old and remove references to the constant pool
  688:     %% in all processes.
  689:     true = erlang:delete_module(literals),
  690:     Ms = [spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  691:                                 false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, literals)
  692:                         end) || Pid <- Pids],
  693:     [receive
  694:          {'DOWN',R,process,P,normal} ->
  695:              ok
  696:      end || {P,R} <- Ms],
  697: 
  698:     %% Purge the code.
  699:     true = erlang:purge_module(literals),
  700: 
  701:     %% Tell the processes that the code has been purged.
  702:     [begin
  703:          monitor(process, Pid),
  704:          Pid ! purged
  705:      end || Pid <- Pids],
  706: 
  707:     %% Wait for all processes to terminate.
  708:     [receive
  709:          {'DOWN',_,process,Pid,normal} ->
  710:              ok
  711:      end || Pid <- Pids],
  712: 
  713:     %% We now expect that the binary has been deallocated.
  714:     provoke_mem_leak(N-1, Code, Check).
  715: 
  716: create_binaries(Parent, NumRefs, Check) ->
  717:     Bin = literals:binary(),
  718:     Bins = lists:duplicate(NumRefs, Bin),
  719:     {bits,Bits} = literals:bits(),
  720:     Parent ! {started,self()},
  721:     receive
  722:         purged ->
  723:             %% The code has been purged. Now make sure that
  724:             %% the binaries haven't been corrupted.
  725:             Check = erlang:md5(Bin),
  726:             [Bin = B || B <- Bins],
  727:             <<42:13,Bin/binary>> = Bits,
  728: 
  729:             %% Remove all references to the binaries
  730:             %% Doing it explicitly like this ensures that
  731:             %% the binaries are gone when the parent process
  732:             %% receives the 'DOWN' message.
  733:             erlang:garbage_collect()
  734:     end.
  735: 
  736: wait_for_memory_deallocations() ->
  737:     try
  738:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations)
  739:     catch
  740:         error:undef ->
  741:             erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  742:             wait_for_memory_deallocations()
  743:     end.
  744: 
  745: fake_literals(_Config) ->
  746:     Mod = fake__literals__module,
  747:     try
  748:         do_fake_literals(Mod)
  749:     after
  750:         _ = code:purge(Mod),
  751:         _ = code:delete(Mod),
  752:         _ = code:purge(Mod),
  753:         _ = code:delete(Mod)
  754:     end,
  755:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  756:     ok.
  757: 
  758: do_fake_literals(Mod) ->
  759:     Tid = ets:new(test, []),
  760:     ExtTerms = get_external_terms(),
  761:     Term0 = {self(),make_ref(),Tid,fun() -> ok end,ExtTerms},
  762:     Terms = [begin
  763:                  make_literal_module(Mod, Term0),
  764:                  Mod:term()
  765:              end || _ <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  766:     verify_lit_terms(Terms, Term0),
  767:     true = ets:delete(Tid),
  768:     ok.
  769: 
  770: make_literal_module(Mod, Term) ->
  771:     Exp = [{term,0}],
  772:     Attr = [],
  773:     Fs = [{function,term,0,2,
  774:            [{label,1},
  775:             {line,[]},
  776:             {func_info,{atom,Mod},{atom,term},0},
  777:             {label,2},
  778:             {move,{literal,Term},{x,0}},
  779:             return]}],
  780:     Asm = {Mod,Exp,Attr,Fs,3},
  781:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:forms(Asm, [from_asm,binary,report]),
  782:     code:load_binary(Mod, atom_to_list(Mod), Beam).
  783: 
  784: verify_lit_terms([H|T], Term) ->
  785:     case H =:= Term of
  786:         true ->
  787:             verify_lit_terms(T, Term);
  788:         false ->
  789:             error({bad_term,H})
  790:     end;
  791: verify_lit_terms([], _) ->
  792:     ok.
  793: 
  794: get_external_terms() ->
  795:     {ok, Peer, Node}= ?CT_PEER(),
  796:     Ref = rpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []),
  797:     Ports = rpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, []),
  798:     Pid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []),
  799:     peer:stop(Peer),
  800:     {Ref,hd(Ports),Pid}.
  801: 
  802: %% OTP-7559: c_p->cp could contain garbage and create a false dependency
  803: %% to a module in a process. (Thanks to Richard Carlsson.)
  804: false_dependency(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  805:     run_sys_proc_test(fun false_dependency_test/1, Config).
  806: 
  807: false_dependency_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  808:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  809:     File = filename:join(Data, "cpbugx"),
  810:     {ok,cpbugx,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary,report]),
  811: 
  812:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before/0, Code),
  813:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before2/0, Code),
  814:     do_false_dependency(fun cpbugx:before3/0, Code),
  815: 
  816:     ok.
  817: 
  818: do_false_dependency(Init, Code) ->
  819:     {module,cpbugx} = erlang:load_module(cpbugx, Code),
  820: 
  821:     %% Spawn process. Make sure it has the appropriate init function
  822:     %% and returned. CP should not contain garbage after the return.
  823:     Parent = self(),
  824:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, true) end),
  825:     receive initialized -> ok end,
  826: 
  827:     %% Reload the module. Make sure the process is still alive.
  828:     {module,cpbugx} = erlang:load_module(cpbugx, Code),
  829:     io:put_chars(binary_to_list(element(2, process_info(Pid, backtrace)))),
  830:     true = is_process_alive(Pid),
  831: 
  832:     %% There should not be any dependency to cpbugx.
  833:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, cpbugx),
  834: 
  835:     %% Kill the process and completely unload the code.
  836:     unlink(Pid), exit(Pid, kill),
  837:     true = erlang:purge_module(cpbugx),
  838:     true = erlang:delete_module(cpbugx),
  839:     true = erlang:purge_module(cpbugx),
  840:     ok.
  841: 
  842: false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, SendInitAck) ->
  843:     Init(),
  844:     case SendInitAck of
  845:         true -> Parent ! initialized;
  846:         false -> void
  847:                  %% Just send one init-ack. I guess the point of this test
  848:                  %% wasn't to fill parents msg-queue (?). Seen to cause
  849:                  %% out-of-mem (on halfword-vm for some reason) by
  850:                  %% 91 million msg in queue. /sverker
  851:     end,
  852:     receive
  853:         _ -> false_dependency_loop(Parent, Init, false)
  854:     end.
  855: 
  856: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  857:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:purge_module({a,b,c})),
  858:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:check_process_code(not_a_pid, ?MODULE)),
  859:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:check_process_code(self(), [not_a_module])),
  860:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:delete_module([a,b,c])),
  861:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:module_loaded(42)),
  862:     ok.
  863: 
  864: fun_confusion(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  865:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  866:     Src = filename:join(Data, "fun_confusion"),
  867:     Mod = fun_confusion,
  868: 
  869:     %% Load first version of module.
  870:     compile_load(Mod, Src, 1),
  871:     F1 = Mod:f(),
  872:     1 = F1(),
  873: 
  874:     %% Load second version of module.
  875:     compile_load(Mod, Src, 2),
  876:     F2 = Mod:f(),
  877: 
  878:     %% F1 should refer to the old code, not the newly loaded code.
  879:     1 = F1(),
  880:     2 = F2(),
  881:     ok.
  882: 
  883: compile_load(Mod, Src, Ver) ->
  884:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = compile:file(Src, [binary,{d,version,Ver}]),
  885:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "fun_confusion.beam", Code1),
  886:     ok.
  887: 
  888: 
  889: t_copy_literals(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  890:     run_sys_proc_test(fun t_copy_literals_test/1, Config).
  891: 
  892: t_copy_literals_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  893:     %% Compile the the literals module.
  894:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  895:     File = filename:join(Data, "literals"),
  896:     {ok,literals,Code} = compile:file(File, [report,binary]),
  897:     {module,literals} = erlang:load_module(literals, Code),
  898: 
  899:     N   = 30,
  900:     Me  = self(),
  901:     %% reload literals code every 567 ms
  902:     Rel = spawn_link(fun() -> reloader(literals,Code,567) end),
  903:     %% add new literal msgs to the loop every 789 ms
  904:     Sat = spawn_link(fun() -> saturate(Me,789) end),
  905:     %% run for 10s
  906:     _   = spawn_link(fun() -> receive after 10000 -> Me ! done end end),
  907:     ok  = chase_msg(N, Me),
  908:     %% cleanup
  909:     Rel ! done,
  910:     Sat ! done,
  911:     %% Trap exit. We don't want to be killed if/when our spawned
  912:     %% processes fail when we remove the literals module...
  913:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  914:     catch erlang:purge_module(literals),
  915:     catch erlang:delete_module(literals),
  916:     catch erlang:purge_module(literals),
  917:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  918:     ok  = flush(),
  919:     ok.
  920: 
  921: -define(mod, t_copy_literals_frags).
  922: t_copy_literals_frags(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  923:     run_sys_proc_test(fun t_copy_literals_frags_test/1, Config).
  924: 
  925: t_copy_literals_frags_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  926:     Bin = gen_lit(?mod,[{a,{1,2,3,4,5,6,7}},
  927:                         {b,"hello world"},
  928:                         {c, <<"hello world">>},
  929:                         {d, {"hello world", {1.0, 2.0, <<"some">>, "string"}}},
  930:                         {e, <<"off heap", 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  931:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  932:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  933:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  934:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  935:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15,
  936:                                           0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
  937:                                           8, 9,10,11,12,13,14,15>>},
  938:                         {f, fun ?MODULE:all/0}]),
  939: 
  940:     {module, ?mod} = erlang:load_module(?mod, Bin),
  941:     N = 6000,
  942:     Recv = spawn_opt(fun() -> receive
  943:                                   read ->
  944:                                       io:format("reading"),
  945:                                       literal_receiver()
  946:                               end
  947:                      end, [link,{min_heap_size, 10000}]),
  948:     Switcher = spawn_link(fun() -> literal_switcher() end),
  949:     Pids = [spawn_opt(fun() -> receive
  950:                                    {Pid, go, Recv, N} ->
  951:                                        io:format("sender batch (~w) start ~w~n",[N,self()]),
  952:                                        literal_sender(N,Recv),
  953:                                        Pid ! {self(), ok}
  954:                                end
  955:                       end, [link,{min_heap_size,800}]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  956:     _ = [Pid ! {self(), go, Recv, N} || Pid <- Pids],
  957:     %% don't read immediately
  958:     timer:sleep(5),
  959:     Recv ! read,
  960:     Switcher ! {switch,?mod,Bin,[Recv|Pids],200},
  961:     _ = [receive {Pid, ok} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  962:     Switcher ! {self(), done},
  963:     receive {Switcher, ok} -> ok end,
  964:     Recv ! {self(), done},
  965:     receive {Recv, ok} -> ok end,
  966:     catch erlang:purge_module(?mod),
  967:     catch erlang:delete_module(?mod),
  968:     catch erlang:purge_module(?mod),
  969:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(5000),
  970:     ok.
  971: 
  972: literal_receiver() ->
  973:     receive
  974:         {Pid, done} ->
  975:             io:format("reader_done~n"),
  976:             Pid ! {self(), ok};
  977:         {_Pid, msg, [A,B,C,D,E]} ->
  978:             A = ?mod:a(),
  979:             B = ?mod:b(),
  980:             C = ?mod:c(),
  981:             D = ?mod:d(),
  982:             E = ?mod:e(),
  983:             F = ?mod:f(),
  984:             literal_receiver();
  985:         {Pid, sender_confirm} ->
  986:             io:format("sender confirm ~w~n", [Pid]),
  987:             Pid ! {self(), ok},
  988:             literal_receiver()
  989:     end.
  990: 
  991: literal_sender(0, Recv) ->
  992:     Recv ! {self(), sender_confirm},
  993:     receive {Recv, ok} -> ok end;
  994: literal_sender(N, Recv) ->
  995:     Recv ! {self(), msg, [?mod:a(),
  996:                           ?mod:b(),
  997:                           ?mod:c(),
  998:                           ?mod:d(),
  999:                           ?mod:e(),
 1000:                           ?mod:f()]},
 1001:     literal_sender(N - 1, Recv).
 1002: 
 1003: literal_switcher() ->
 1004:     receive
 1005:         {switch,Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo} ->
 1006:             literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo)
 1007:     end.
 1008: literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo) ->
 1009:     receive
 1010:         {Pid,done} ->
 1011:             Pid ! {self(),ok}
 1012:     after Tmo ->
 1013:               io:format("load module ~w~n", [Mod]),
 1014:               {module, Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod,Bin),
 1015:               ok = check_and_purge(Pids,Mod),
 1016:               io:format("purge complete ~w~n", [Mod]),
 1017:               literal_switcher(Mod,Bin,Pids,Tmo+Tmo)
 1018:     end.
 1019: 
 1020: check_and_purge([],Mod) ->
 1021:     erlang:purge_module(Mod),
 1022:     ok;
 1023: check_and_purge(Pids,Mod) ->
 1024:     io:format("purge ~w~n", [Mod]),
 1025:     Tag = make_ref(),
 1026:     _ = [begin
 1027:              erlang:check_process_code(Pid,Mod,[{async,{Tag,Pid}}])
 1028:          end || Pid <- Pids],
 1029:     Retry = check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,[]),
 1030:     check_and_purge(Retry,Mod).
 1031: 
 1032: check_and_purge_receive([Pid|Pids],Tag,Retry) ->
 1033:     receive
 1034:         {check_process_code, {Tag, Pid}, false} ->
 1035:             check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,Retry);
 1036:         {check_process_code, {Tag, Pid}, true} ->
 1037:             check_and_purge_receive(Pids,Tag,[Pid|Retry])
 1038:     end;
 1039: check_and_purge_receive([],_,Retry) ->
 1040:     Retry.
 1041: 
 1042: 
 1043: gen_lit(Module,Terms) ->
 1044:     FunStrings = [lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w() -> ~w.~n", [F,Term]))||{F,Term}<-Terms],
 1045:     FunForms = function_forms(FunStrings),
 1046:     Forms    = [{attribute,erl_anno:new(1),module,Module},
 1047:                 {attribute,erl_anno:new(2),export,[FA || {FA,_} <- FunForms]}] ++
 1048:                [Function || {_, Function} <- FunForms],
 1049:     {ok, Module, Bin} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1050:     Bin.
 1051: 
 1052: function_forms([]) -> [];
 1053: function_forms([S|Ss]) ->
 1054:     {ok, Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(S),
 1055:     {ok, Form} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 1056:     Fun   = element(3, Form),
 1057:     Arity = element(4, Form),
 1058:     [{{Fun,Arity}, Form}|function_forms(Ss)].
 1059: 
 1060: chase_msg(0, Pid) ->
 1061:     chase_loop(Pid);
 1062: chase_msg(N, Master) ->
 1063:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> chase_msg(N - 1,Master) end),
 1064:     chase_loop(Pid).
 1065: 
 1066: chase_loop(Pid) ->
 1067:     receive
 1068:         done ->
 1069:             Pid ! done,
 1070:             ok;
 1071:         {_From,Msg} ->
 1072:             Pid ! {self(), Msg},
 1073:             ok = traverse(Msg),
 1074:             chase_loop(Pid)
 1075:     end.
 1076: 
 1077: saturate(Pid,Time) ->
 1078:     Es = [msg1,msg2,msg3,msg4,msg5],
 1079:     Msg = [literals:E()||E <- Es],
 1080:     Pid ! {self(), Msg},
 1081:     receive
 1082:         done -> ok
 1083:     after Time ->
 1084:               saturate(Pid,Time)
 1085:     end.
 1086: 
 1087: traverse([]) -> ok;
 1088: traverse([H|T]) ->
 1089:     ok = traverse(H),
 1090:     traverse(T);
 1091: traverse(T) when is_tuple(T) -> ok;
 1092: traverse(B) when is_binary(B) -> ok;
 1093: traverse(I) when is_integer(I) -> ok;
 1094: traverse(#{ 1 := V1, b := V2 }) ->
 1095:     ok = traverse(V1),
 1096:     ok = traverse(V2),
 1097:     ok.
 1098: 
 1099: 
 1100: reloader(Mod,Code,Time) ->
 1101:     receive
 1102:         done -> ok
 1103:     after Time ->
 1104:               code:purge(Mod),
 1105:               {module,Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod, Code),
 1106:               reloader(Mod,Code,Time)
 1107:     end.
 1108: 
 1109: erl_544(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1110:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1111:         utf8 ->
 1112:             {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1113:             try
 1114:                 Mod = erl_544,
 1115:                 FileName = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1116:                 Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1117:                 Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1118:                 {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join(Data,
 1119:                                                                  FileName)),
 1120:                 Dir = filename:join(Priv, [16#2620,16#2620,16#2620]),
 1121:                 File = filename:join(Dir, FileName),
 1122:                 io:format("~ts~n", [File]),
 1123:                 ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1124:                 ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
 1125:                 ok = file:write_file(File, [FileContent]),
 1126:                 {ok, Mod} = compile:file(File),
 1127:                 Res1 = (catch Mod:err()),
 1128:                 io:format("~p~n", [Res1]),
 1129:                 {'EXIT', {err, [{Mod, err, 0, Info1}|_]}} = Res1,
 1130:                 File = proplists:get_value(file, Info1),
 1131:                 Me = self(),
 1132:                 Go = make_ref(),
 1133:                 Tester = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1134:                                             Mod:wait(Me, Go),
 1135:                                             Mod:err()
 1136:                                     end),
 1137:                 receive Go -> ok end,
 1138:                 Res2 = process_info(Tester, current_stacktrace),
 1139:                 io:format("~p~n", [Res2]),
 1140:                 {current_stacktrace, Stack} = Res2,
 1141:                 [{Mod, wait, 2, Info2}|_] = Stack,
 1142:                 File = proplists:get_value(file, Info2),
 1143:                 StackFun = fun(_, _, _) -> false end,
 1144:                 FormatFun = fun (Term, _) -> io_lib:format("~tp", [Term]) end,
 1145:                 Formatted =
 1146:                     erl_error:format_stacktrace(1, Stack, StackFun, FormatFun),
 1147:                 true = is_list(Formatted),
 1148:                 ok
 1149:             after
 1150:                 ok = file:set_cwd(CWD)
 1151:             end,
 1152:             ok;
 1153:         _Enc ->
 1154:             {skipped, "Only run when native file name encoding is utf8"}
 1155:     end.
 1156: 
 1157: %% Test that the copying of literals to a process during purging of
 1158: %% literals will cause the process to be killed if the max heap size
 1159: %% is exceeded.
 1160: max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 1161:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1162:     Value = [I || I <- lists:seq(1, 5000)],
 1163:     Code = gen_lit(Mod, [{term,Value}]),
 1164:     {module,Mod} = erlang:load_module(Mod, Code),
 1165:     SpawnOpts = [monitor,
 1166:                  {max_heap_size,
 1167:                   #{size=>1024,
 1168:                     kill=>true,
 1169:                     error_logger=>true}}],
 1170:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_opt(fun() ->
 1171:                                   max_heap_size_proc(Mod)
 1172:                           end, SpawnOpts),
 1173:     receive
 1174:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Reason} ->
 1175:             killed = Reason;
 1176:         Other ->
 1177:             ct:fail({unexpected_message,Other})
 1178:     after 10000 ->
 1179:             ct:fail({process_did_not_die, Pid, erlang:process_info(Pid)})
 1180:     end.
 1181: 
 1182: max_heap_size_proc(Mod) ->
 1183:     Value = Mod:term(),
 1184:     code:delete(Mod),
 1185:     code:purge(Mod),
 1186:     receive
 1187:         _ -> Value
 1188:     end.
 1189: 
 1190: check_process_code_signal_order(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1191:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1192:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1193:     {module,versions} = erlang:load_module(versions, compile_version(1, Config)),
 1194:     Pid = spawn_opt(versions, loop, [], [{scheduler, 1}]),
 1195:     true = erlang:delete_module(versions),
 1196:     true = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, versions),
 1197:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1198:     spam_signals(Pid, 10000),
 1199:     %% EXIT signal *should* arrive...
 1200:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1201:     %% ... before CPC signal...
 1202:     async = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, versions, [{async, Ref}]),
 1203:     %% ... which means that the result of the check_process_code *should* be 'false'...
 1204:     false = busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref),
 1205:     ok.
 1206: 
 1207: busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref) ->
 1208:     receive
 1209: 	{check_process_code, Ref, Res} ->
 1210: 	    Res
 1211:     after 0 ->
 1212: 	    busy_wait_cpc_res(Ref)
 1213:     end.
 1214: 
 1215: spam_signals(P, N) when N =< 0 ->
 1216:     ok;
 1217: spam_signals(P, N) ->
 1218:     link(P),
 1219:     unlink(P),
 1220:     spam_signals(P, N-2).
 1221: 
 1222: check_process_code_dirty_exec_proc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1223:     Pid = spawn(fun () ->
 1224: 			erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 10000)
 1225: 		end),
 1226:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1227:     false = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, non_existing_module),
 1228:     {status, running} = process_info(Pid, status),
 1229:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1230:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1231:     ok.
 1232: 
 1233: %% Utilities.
 1234: 
 1235: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1236:     {_,B1} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin,4,5,6,7]), 3),
 1237:     {B,_} = split_binary(B1, size(Bin)),
 1238:     B;
 1239: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1240:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1241: 
 1242: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1243:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1244:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1245:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1246:     Bin.
 1247: 
 1248: %% Add 1 bit to the size of the binary.
 1249: bit_sized_binary(Bin0) ->
 1250:     Bin = <<Bin0/binary,1:1>>,
 1251:     BitSize = bit_size(Bin),
 1252:     BitSize = 8*size(Bin) + 1,
 1253:     Bin.
 1254: 
 1255: flush() ->
 1256:     receive _ -> flush() after 0 -> ok end.
 1257: 
 1258: id(I) -> I.
 1259: 
 1260: 
 1261: run_sys_proc_test(Test, Config) ->
 1262:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 1263:     
 1264:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 1265:                       true -> 1;
 1266:                       false -> 5
 1267:                   end,
 1268: 
 1269:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 1270:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 1271:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 1272:     try
 1273:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 1274:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 1275:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 1276:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 1277:                     _ ->
 1278:                         10000
 1279:                 end,
 1280:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 1281:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 1282:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1283:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 1284:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 1285:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 1286:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1287:                               unlink(P),
 1288:                               exit(P, kill)
 1289:                       end, Ps),
 1290:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 1291:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 1292:         {Res1, Res2}
 1293:     after
 1294:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 1295:     end.
